name: 1H-pyrazole-5-methanol, 3-methyl-
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-3901
Reason: 1H-pyrazole-5-methanol has a melting point influenced by its functional groups relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The methyl group introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +10°C. The pyrazole ring introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, raising the melting point by about +30°C. The methyl group also introduces a more asymmetric structure, reducing the crystal lattice stability, which might decrease the melting point by approximately -10°C.
